description: Verlan (or metathesis) form of French chassé, past participle of chasser (“chase”), from Latin captō, frequentative of capiō (“I take”).

entries.meaning: A sequence of sideways steps in a circle in square dancing.

verbs.description: sashay (third-person singular simple present sashays, present participle sashaying, simple past and past participle sashayed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To walk casually, showily or in a flirty manner; to strut, swagger or flounce.

examples: Games can hinge on the sort of controversial decision made by Taylor in the 10th minute. After Rivière collected Gabriel Obertan’s pass and sashayed beyond Daley Blind he drew the United centre- half into a rash, clumsy challenge but, puzzlingly, Taylor detected no penalty.
